text: when developing chaincode, is it enough to test it on a single noops peer or it's better to test it with enough peers to use pbft consensus and membersrvc?
btw I do not know why I did not join this channel
<@U1JB7QCBD> from the chaincode's perspective, I don't see the difference
<@U1JB7QCBD> I don't believe it matters how many peers you use.
well, now I have to add my bit :wink: …. I develop in `—peer-chaincodedev` mode with just one peer and no docker… the turnaround for fixing bugs etc is much better.

<@U1JB7QCBD> please keep in mind that this is the peak of summer holiday season, and many of the usual suspects are either on holiday or trying to keep things going while others are… I wouldn’t take it as a slight that you aren’t getting answers immediately

In answer, I would say that noops is good enough for most testing, but to ensure that you haven’t written non-deterministic chaincode, multi-node testing is likely a requirement before deploying it in anger

Hi,
         I was trying to deploy chaincode, it was working fine until now. Today, I just pulled latest docker images and started 4  peers. I was trying to deploy chaincode_example02 from one of the peers.
```  peer chaincode deploy -n mycc -c '{"Function":"init", "Args": ["a","100", "b", "200"]}'   
Error: Non-empty JSON chaincode parameters must contain exactly 1 key: 'Args' ```


Later found that with the latest code, format was changed. Parameter "Function" was moved to "Args" array. All parameters should be base64 encoded. So, tried with the following option

```  peer chaincode deploy -n mycc -c {"args":['aW5pdA==', 'YQ==', 'MTAwMA==', 'Yg==', 'MjAwMA==']}
Error: Chaincode argument error: invalid character 'a' looking for beginning of object key string ```

Not sure what I am doing wrong here...
vacation is a strange thing for me, not something i usually do, that might contribute to the fact that i forgot that others do it :smile:
